name: market for electricity, medium voltage, renewable energy products | electricity, medium voltage, renewable energy products | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/8577/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This dataset describes the electricity from renewable sources available on the medium voltage level in Switzerland.;The shares of electricity technologies on this market are valid for the year 2021. They have been calculated by the data provider and don't necessarily correspond with the production volumes entered in the undefined datasets of the different electricity producers. The shares have been calculated based on statistics from 2021: Swiss Federal Office of Energy SFOE, Swiss Electricity Statistics 2021; (https://www.bfe.admin.ch/bfe/en/home.html).

This activity starts from 1kWh of electricity from renewable sources fed into the medium voltage transmission network.

This activity ends with the transport of 1 kWh of medium voltage electricity from renewable sources in the transmission network over aerial lines and cables. This dataset includes: - electricity inputs produced in this country and from imports and transformed to medium voltage - the transmission network - direct emissions to air (SF6 from the insulation gas in the high voltage level switchgear are allocated to the electricity demand on medium voltage). - electricity losses during transmission This dataset doesn't include - electricity losses during transformation from high to medium voltage or medium to low, as these are included in the dataset for transformation - leakage of insulation oil from cables and electro technical equipment (transformers, switchgear, circuit breakers) because this only happens in case of accidental release - SF6 emissions during production and deconstruction of the switchgear, as these are accounted for in the transmission network dataset.
category: D:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/35:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/351:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution/3510:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The 'Start of Period' and 'End of Period' do not refer to the year for which this market is valid. See general comment for the year for which the shares are based on.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Average technology used to transmit and distribute electricity. Includes underground and overhead lines, as well as air-, vacuum- and SF6-insulated high-to-medium voltage switching stations. Electricity production according to related technology datasets.;Definition of the voltage levels:;- High voltage level above 24 kV (large scale industry);- Medium voltage level between 1 kV and 24 kV (medium to small scale industry, service sector;and public buildings);- Low voltage level below 1 kV (Households)
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Data for the market are valid for 2011. Electricity losses and infrastrucuture requirements are assumed to be equal to the "normal" Swiss medium voltage market.

exchanges.description: Literature value/estimation. SF6 (sulphur hexafluoride) is used as quenching and insulation gas in gas-insulated switchgear. SF6 has physically ideal properties for the use in high and medium voltage switchgear. Most of SF6-emissions (ca. 95%) are caused by the high voltage level switchgear, which are allocated to the electricity demand on medium voltage. The emission rate of 1.0% has been taken from UBA (1999) Schwefelhexafluorid. Retrieved 14.8.2002 from: http://www.ubavie.gv.at/publikationen/uba-aktuell/archiv/1999/08/SF6.html.
Calculated from electricity generation and trade statistics. See general comment for validity and sources.

exchanges.description: Estimation. Swiss data are calculated values based on the electricity transported in this voltage level (57268 GWh) and the total medium voltage power line length in Switzerland (cables and aerial lines - 42671 km). Lifetime is assumed to be 40 years. See Itten&Frischknecht 2012, Tab. 4.1 and Tab. 4.3.
